page.title: 02Local customs in Sandwich.
page.content: Sandwich maintains a number of local customs, e.g. the ringing of the curfew bell from St. Peter's Church at 8 o'clock each night. Another such custom is for the Town Sergeant to find and cut a blackthorn stick to present to the Mayor. This is supposed to ward off evil sprits and witches. The Sergeant gets a crown coin in return. A further tradition is the "Conformation of the Mayor Deputies" who come from Brightlingsea, Fordwich and Sarre. Deputies have to pay "Ship money" of 50p, 17p and 8.5p respectively. Sarre, short of funds, had been unable to pay this tax for 400 years. Finally, the "Bun Run" occurs at St. Bart's Hospital on 24th August, St. Bart's Day. Children run round its chapel and receive a current bun. The adults, who do not run, get biscuits.
